parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>False. There is no CMF number present in the provided text.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>True. While the post doesn't explicitly mention a candidate by name, it refers to "those who deserve to represent you in Parliament," implicitly referencing the parliamentary elections and those running for office.  The "USR Caraș-Severin" byline strongly suggests an association with the USR party and its candidates.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>True. The post is a paid Facebook advertisement, inherently designed to reach a wide audience. The message is not a private communication but a public statement.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>True. The concluding sentence, urging voters to "offer your trust to those you believe deserve to represent you in Parliament," directly aims to influence voting behavior in the parliamentary elections.  The timing of the post, close to the election, further strengthens this interpretation.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>False. The content is not journalistic in nature. It lacks objective reporting, analysis, or diverse perspectives. Instead, it promotes a particular viewpoint and encourages support for a specific party.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>False. While the initial part expresses personal sentiments, the concluding sentence clearly transcends personal opinion and becomes a direct appeal for votes.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>2898751980281073</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The Facebook post, paid for by USR Caraș-Severin, promotes the USR party by implicitly encouraging voters to support its candidates in the upcoming parliamentary elections.  The post's concluding sentence directly urges voters to choose candidates they believe deserve representation in Parliament.  While the initial part expresses personal sentiments, the overall message is clearly designed to influence voting behavior. The use of a paid Facebook advertisement ensures wide dissemination, fulfilling the criteria of addressing the public. The post's timing, close to the election, further strengthens the argument that it constitutes electoral propaganda.  The lack of a CMF number is not a decisive factor, as the context and content clearly indicate an electoral objective.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>TRUE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates>
  <candidate><name>Andrei Plujar</name><impact>POSITIVE</impact></candidate>
</electoral-propaganda-candidates>
<responsible-party-or-group>USR</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police>
USR Caraș-Severin, pentru încălcarea articolului 98 t) din LEGEA nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015, prin publicarea unei postări plătite pe Facebook (ID: 2898751980281073), după ora 18:00 pe 23.11.2024, cu scopul de a influența votul în alegerile parlamentare. Postarea, deși începe cu o declarație personală, culminează cu o îndemnare directă la vot pentru candidații considerați demni de încredere,  "oferind încrederea celor care credeți de cuviință că merită să vă reprezinte în Parlament".  Acest apel direct la vot, combinat cu bugetul alocat publicității (RON 200-RON 299),  ajungând la 10.000-15.000 de impresii, constituie propagandă electorală interzisă după încheierea perioadei legale de campanie.  Contact: caras-severin.judet@usr.ro, +40759017677.
</message-for-police>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
